Action: Peter, Lois, Chris, Meg, Brian, and Stewie walk into the exquisite movie theater.
They have just ordered their tickets for the movie.

Dialogue: Here are your tickets.  Enjoy your movie.
Ok, kids, you guys go and save us a seat while we get the food. Oh, Peter.  It sure is nice to go out and do something as a family again.
Yeah.  We haven't been to the movies in a long time.
It's no wonder.  You remember the last time we all went to the movies?

Action: There's a silence and moment of motionlessness.

Dialogue: Uh, yeah.  It seems like it was only yesterday...

Action: Another silence.

Dialogue: Ok, why isn't it showing the flashback?
It's probably just a technical error, Peter.  I'm sure they'll have it working in no time.

Action: Silence.  Brian, Peter, and Lois wait for the flashback to come on.  Nothing.

Dialogue: Damn this network.  Always screwing up our lives. How the hell are we going to tell our story if we can't even have one flashback? This is just like the time I started that petition to bring back Butt Ugly Martians. There's no flashback.
That's it.  I quit... The opening theme starts.

Action: Chris and Meg, who is carrying Stewie, are ordering some food for the movie.

Dialogue: Yeah, can I get one large popcorn with extra butter, two medium cokes, and some Twizzlers?

Action: The employee behind the register puts a sign up on the counter.  It reads: NO DOGS ALLOWED.

Dialogue: Next!
Oh, don't frown upon your hideousness, Meg.  I'm sure it comes in quite useful when you need to get out of a certain situation.
Stewie, you're getting too heavy for me to carry you anymore.
Too heavy?  Now listen here, David Lee Roth, I work out thirty minutes a day while on a special diet designed by Taebo fitness instructor Billy Blanks.
Stewie, you're gonna have to walk.
Action: She sets Stewie down. Stewie jumps up and down, demanding to be picked back up and carried.

Dialogue: Why, you fobbing flap-mouthed lewdster! Pick me back up! I refuse to walk on this mess you call a floor. Who knows what's been on it!

Action: An old man walks by with muddy shoes. The mud wipes onto the carpet. Suddenly, the man trips on his own feet, and his face hits the floor hard. His false teeth fly out of his mouth, transmitting gooey saliva all over the floor. Stewie gasps and becomes sickened.

Dialogue: Oh, that's disgusting!
Action: She immediately hurls up her lunch. The vomit spreads across the floor, and another passing moviegoer slips in the puke. A young kid runs out of the bathroom with toilet paper attached to his shoe.

Dialogue: Oh, God...
Action: Stewie faints.
Everyone is watching the movie. The previews are playing.
CLOSE ON THEATER SCREEN. THE FOLLOWING PREVIEW HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR ALL AUDIENCES BY AN ASSOCIATION WHO DESTROYS FILMS. A reptile of some sort is on the screen attacking people.

Dialogue: They're fast... they're vicious... they're completely inane... and this summer, you have to put up with them... again!

Action: The main title of the movie emerges on screen: ANACONDAS 3.

Dialogue: Starring Jean Stapleton as the sexy scientist.
If we don't come up with an idea of how these things got so big, WE'RE ALL DEAD!
Action: JEAN appears on screen, looking old and unhealthy.

Dialogue: ...and Cliff Robertson in his most groundbreaking role ever as the villainous boat passenger...
I'm here for no reason than to complicate matters, and to chew bubble gum. And damn it, I'm all out of bubble gum!
This is the film you have to see to believe...
Action: The title appears again: ANACONDAS 3.
Everyone in the theater is silent.

Dialogue: I am so there.

Action: Stewie is on Lois's lap, fidgeting and fussing as he's terrified of the gross floor. Lois is becoming agitated as well.

Dialogue: Stewie, sit still. You're bothering Mommy.
Lois, it's that damn floor! It'll kill us all, I tell you! ALL OF US! It's a germ infested, noxious, contaminated killing machine! DON'T LET IT GET ME!
Action: Stewie climbs on top of Lois's head.

Dialogue: That's it, Stewie! I told you to stop.
Action: She pulls Stewie off of her head and sets him on the floor. Stewie howls in fear and disgust as his feet stick to the floor like a magnet on a fridge.

Dialogue: Lois, for God's sake! Look, we can forget about the times when I tried to slaughter you, right? Lois? WOMAN, SAVE MEEE!!!
Action: He falls over, and his face sticks to the floor like a cockroach in a Roach Motel.

Dialogue: Stuck... stuck... STUCK!
Action: He tries to pull away, but his skin remains glued to the sticky floor. He begins to cry. People in the audience become irritated.

Dialogue: CAN YOU SHUT THAT BABY UP!?
WE'RE TRYING TO WATCH A MOVIE HERE!
Brian, can you take Stewie out to the lobby?
Action: Lois leans over to Brian.

Dialogue: Sure, Lois.
Action: Brian stands up and picks up Stewie. Stewie's face peels off of the floor and stretches as Stewie finally stands completely. Brian picks Stewie up and walks out of the theater with him.

Dialogue: Brian! Get off of the floor!
Action: Stewie jumps onto a bench and quivers at the sight of the floor.

Dialogue: What for?
There's no time! I'll save you!
Action: Stewie jumps off of the bench and tackles Brian to the floor, smashing a potted plant to pieces as the vase breaks into tiny fragments. Stewie lifts Brian up from his collar and pulls him onto the bench. Stewie is out of breath and Brian is confused.

Dialogue: Stewie, what the hell?
We're safe here. Not forever, but for now.
What were we not safe from to begin with?
I'll show you.
Action: Stewie leans over the bench and peers at the floor.

Dialogue: There. Just below us. Frightening, isn't it?
Stewie, are you talking about the floor?
NO! What's ON the floor...!
The carpet?
I'm sorry, sir, but there's no dogs allowed in the theater. And every infant must have an adult with them over the age of 18.
Action: A THEATER USHER approaches Brian and Stewie. The one that turned Meg away.

Dialogue: Over 18? I'm 49 years old!
And human.
You can't do that. I'm a paying customer.
It's our policy, sir, and I can't bend the rules to satisfy what you think is right.
Why, you...
Action: Brian lifts his fist. Suddenly, the floor begins shaking.
AN EARTHQUAKE! The floor begins splitting and cracking. The ceiling wilts and tarnishes as broken beams fall to the floor. A beam falls on the THEATER USHER, knocking him unconscious.

Dialogue: OH MY GOD! IT'S AN EARTHQUAKE!
IT'S THE FLOOR, I TELL YOU! THE FLOOR! IT'S HERE!!!

Action: The movie playing on screen becomes loud as an action scene takes place. The movie theater begins to shake. The aisles split in half and the ceiling caves in. Everybody panics and runs for their lives. Lois grabs Chris and Meg's hands and pulls them to safety from a falling wooden beam.

Dialogue: LET'S GET OUT OF HERE! PETER, COME ON!
Wow. The sound here is incredible.
Action: Peter remains seated. The earthquake suddenly subsides. Everything goes quiet as the movie theater becomes empty, except for Peter. Silence. Peter remains still.

Dialogue: Yes, Daddy. I'm sure I'm all right. (beat) No, Peter wasn't killed in the earthquake.
Action: Lois is on the phone with her father. The rest of the Griffin family is sitting on and around the couch watching Channel 5 News.

Dialogue: A sudden and unexpected earthquake struck Quahog just last night at eight o'clock. The first of its kind since the early 1970's. Seismologists have yet to figure out if there will be any other seismic waves to cause another earthquake in the area, but it's safe to say that we're all lucky it was only a 4.0 on the Richter scale.
That's right, Tom. The damage was moderate, but thank God nobody was seriously injured.

Action: The theater usher is still pinned under the broken beam that fell on him. Beams and broken pieces of wood continue to fall in the background as a result of the earthquake.

Dialogue: Darth Vader. Rise.
Action: The man under the beam isn't the same. He's now dressed in a slick outfit with a handsome black cape. On his head is a dark helmet that projects his heavily breathing voice. This is the familiar Darth Vader from the STAR WARS movies. A beam suddenly falls on him, again. Darth Vader is no more.

Dialogue: Now where the hell am I going to get someone to join the Dark Side...?
Action: The Dark Man laughs an evil laughter. A beam falls on him, too.
Peter is still watching the news. Everyone else has left.

Dialogue: Now we go live to Trisha Takanawa with an in depth look at the damage caused by the horrible earthquake. Trisha?

Thank you, Diane. I'm here in Downtown Quahog where citizens of Rhode Island are joyous to still be living today. As you can see, the earthquake did quite a lot of damage to businesses and stores on this street, and there is a crack in the road wide enough to fit two copies of Chris Farley. (beat) Oh, I see a citizen roaming the area. Let's see if I can get a word with him. Sir!

Action: Trisha approaches a man. It's QUAGMIRE!

Dialogue: Hey, Lois, look! Quagmire's on the tube!
Sir, can I have a word with you?
Sure thing. Maybe later we can do a brief featurette for the DVD. You. Me. Things falling into holes. OH!
Sir, what were you doing when the earthquake struck and how did you feel when it happened?
Well I was having sex with some chick, and the bed started shaking, and I thought it was just some good pushin', but then the whole ceiling started caving in!
And how did you feel?
Well things went from hot to cold pretty quick.  I finished up and she left.
Did you feel at all frightened during this experience?
No.  She had proof that she was 18.
That Quagmire...
Action: Peter smiles.
Lois enters.

Dialogue: Peter, have you seen Chris?
Yeah.  He went upstairs to do some homework.
Peter, Chris never does his homework in his room.
What the big deal?  You should be proud.  The boy's studying at least.
I would be proud, Peter, but he never studies.  Period.  I'm gonna go up and see what he's doing.
No, Lois.  I'll go.  I haven't talked to Chris in a while anyway. Oh man, this is gonna be more hilarious than that time I watched Jaws.
RUN!!
Action: Peter is watching Jaws on an exciting and tense underwater scene.
Peter walks into Chris's bedroom and gasps.
Chris is making out with a girl!

Dialogue: Chris!

Action: Chris gasps and pushes his girlfriend out of the window.  The girl screams as her foot gets tangled up in the rope ladder hanging from it.

Dialogue: Chris, who the hell was that?
Nobody!
Chris, don't you lie to me!  I know a set of boobs when I see one!  Two boobs, I mean.  One set.
Okay...

Action: Peter looks out of the window and sees the girl hanging from the rope ladder upside down.  Peter pulls the rope ladder up and the girl collapses onto Chris's bed. It's CONNIE DEMICO!

Dialogue: Connie Demico!?  Aren't you in Meg's class!?
Yeah.  But-
But you're the hottest piece of ass at Meg's school!  Why are you with Chris?
I met her when we all went to my Open House at school.  She has a brother that's in my grade.
ALRIGHT, SON! You do me and yourself the favor and TAP THAT ASS!
Chris, I still can't believe you're with Connie Freaking Demico!
Action: Everyone in the family, including Connie, is sitting at the table eating.

Dialogue: It's really not a big deal.
May I be excused?

Hell no you can't be excused! The chick that's tongue frenching your brother is the same one that picks on you at school!  Now you're not safe anywhere!  Man, talk about the irony!  And not that Alanis Morissette irony.  This is irony, irony.

Action: LOIS, CHRIS, BRIAN, CONNIE, STEWIE, and MEG are presumably at the dining table (context from text).

Dialogue: Chris, I'm so happy that you found someone to make you happy. And Connie, just so you know, Chris is hung like a mammoth.
So. How long have you two been seeing each other? Is it strange being with each other knowing the age difference?
Look, we've only been together for about two weeks, and we never really thought about our age difference. It's the attraction that matters.
Action: She holds Chris's right hand.

Dialogue: And I'm more attracted to him than anybody else I've been with.
Wait. Wait. Wait. Hold on. You're with Chris, but the attraction is what matters? Is that what you said? The attraction is what's important? And you're with Chris? Ok, just making sure.
Meg, when are you gonna find a handsome boy at your school? Maybe that's the problem. You should try looking for a boyfriend at Chris's school. The popular girls are doing it.
Mom, you always told me to be my own person. I don't care what the popular kids are doing! I don't like any of this!
Action: Meg flips over her plate against the wall and runs off crying.

Dialogue: Meg! Get back here!
Don't worry, Lois. I set a trap on the stairs to stop her that's impossible to fail.

Meg runs up the stairs. She sees a bear trap lying on one of the steps. She jumps over it. The stairs cave in. Meg falls inside. A piano rolls down the steps and falls inside the broken staircase hole. The piano crushes Meg.
Owww...

Action: Lois is putting food on everybody's plates.

Dialogue: So where are you guys gonna go on a date? 'Cause I can hook you up at some snazzy places! I...uhh...I have connections, you know.
You have connections?
Well, sure! We would have never gotten into the movie theater last night if it weren't for me.
Peter, you paid the usher. Any one of us could have done that.
Yeah. Uh huh. Sure. Maybe you should look for a job and quit being jealous, Brian. You're making yourself look bad. He's usually an outside dog.

Action: Brian throws his plate against the wall and walks off, angry that Peter would him degrade him in such a harsh way.

Dialogue: Chris, let's go. I hear they're showing a special screening of Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.
I don't know if that's a good idea. I had a bad experience watching the original movie...

Action: Chris is watching WILLY WONKA AND THE CHOCOLATE FACTORY. He admires all of the chocolate on the television.

Chris runs up to the television and takes a bite out of it. His teeth hit a wire, and it electrocutes him instantly. Chris's hair stands up as electricity spreads through his body. Chris moans as he can't move his teeth, but they're biting down harder on the wires.
There's an explosion, and Chris is knocked back over the couch. The couch falls on its back as Chris continues to moan.

Dialogue: OHHH. That didn't taste good at all!

Action: Connie stands up.

Dialogue: Well what do you want to do then?
SAY YOU WANT TO STUDY! DO IT, SON!
Dad, I don't think I'm comfortable with you commenting on me and Connie's relationship. You seem more enthused than I do. Come on, Connie. Let's go back up to my room.

Action: Chris and Connie dismiss themselves from the room.

Dialogue: CHRIS, THERE'S A VIDEO CAMERA IN MY ROOM IF YOU GET LUCKY. ALRIGHT, SON? Alright.

Action: Meg, Connie, and other students are sitting in science class. Connie is talking to her friends while Meg overhears their conversation.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: So what's going on with you and that 13 year old from the Junior High?

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: Ah, it's great. Things are going so well. I still can't believe it's working out.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Meg smiles, happy that Connie is satisfied with Chris.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: Ha. I can't believe the fatso thinks you really like him.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Meg gasps and turns around.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: Yeah. My ex boyfriend is already jealous. Ha, this is so cool. I never would have expected this plan to work.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Meg is furious. She jumps out of her chair and runs over to Connie.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: Connie Demico! You're using my brother to make your ex boyfriend jealous?

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: No! No! Not at all! Oh, wait. Yeah, I am.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: I can't believe you would sink so low! He didn't do anything to you!

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: What's your problem, Meg? It's not like I'm doing it to you. You should be happy that I'm leaving you alone for once.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: No, this is a new low for you! You're messing with my family and that's not cool!

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: I think your family is messed up enough already.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: If you want to pick on me, whatever. But you leave my brother alone! Now I'm gonna have to be the one to tell him what you've done! And he's gonna be hurt from what I say, when you're the one that did it!

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: You think he'll believe you? Meg, nobody listens to anything you say. Why would your brother be any different? He's obviously clueless.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Dialogue: Connie, I've been wanting to do this for a long time. You've never ached me enough to do it, but this is the worst crap you've ever done, and I think you deserve it!

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Meg swings her fist, and Connie ducks.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Connie swings back, and her fist strikes Meg across the cheek. Meg is knocked back against a test tube rack, and shattered glass showers over the floor.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Meg is furious. She grabs a broken piece of glass and swings it at Connie, trying to slice her. The glass cuts Connie's arm.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Connie retorts with a swing of a science book. The book hits Meg in the forehead.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Meg grabs Connie by the hair and bashes her head against a student desk, faster and faster, harder and harder.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Connie swings her feet from behind, kicking Meg in the chest. Meg falls on the floor. Connie pounces on her like a tiger.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Meg punches Connie in the stomach.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Connie picks Meg up from the floor and lifts her head towards the twirling ceiling fan. The blades of the fan knock Meg in the head.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: Meg grabs a fan blade, yanking it from the ceiling fan. She swings the fan blade at Connie, knocking her repeatedly across the face.

Scene_Location: INT. JAMES WOODS MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL - THE NEXT DAY
Action: The two both fall to the floor, tired and bruised, breathing heavy.
PRINCIPAL SHEPHERD is sitting behind his desk on the phone. Lois, Peter, Meg, and Connie are sitting in front of it.

Dialogue: Ok, Connie, your parents are on their way. Now Meg, Mr. and Mrs. Griffin, I am very upset that your daughter was the first to swing at Connie. I would expect that you, as parents, would teach Meg that violence is not a probable solution to any disputes.
Speak English, Lu Xun.
Your daughter will be suspended for the next two days due to her behavior.
WHAT!?
Good!
Oh my God! Principal Shepherd, I know my daughter had a justifiable reason for acting this way. Please, let her explain.
Oh, alright... Start talking, Meg.
Connie is dating my brother, who's only 13. And she's doing it to get back at her ex boyfriend! Not because she likes him!
It's not true!
Meg, why would you think that?
Mom, she told me today! That's why I swung at her! I don't want Chris to be hurt, and if he stays with her, he will be!
Now that still doesn't give you any right to punch a girl! You were taught not to!
The bitch had it coming, and I owed it to her anyway.
I've heard about enough of this nonsense. Meg, personal matters are not to be dealt with at school. I am still suspending you for the next two days.
Well what about Connie? She fought too!
I was defending myself!
She'll get detention for the next week. All of you are dismissed.
Meg, you and I are gonna have a serious conversation about all of this on the way home!

Action: Meg, Peter, and Lois exit the room. Principal Shepherd looks at Connie.

Dialogue: So, Connie, you lookin' for a way to get out of that detention...?

Action: Principal Shepherd licks his lips and winks. Connie stares blankly.
Stewie is standing on the couch with a laser gun pointed at the floor. Brian enters the room.

Dialogue: Stewie, what the hell are you doing?
Waiting, Brian. I might suggest you climb to higher ground if you want stay alive.
Are you scared that there's gonna be another earthquake?
Not at all. I'm prepared! That's what I am!
Stewie, you're two feet off of the ground. That's not gonna protect you if another earthquake does come.
(gasps) You're right! I must find another method of staying off of the floor!

Action: Stewie grabs two stilts and motions towards the stairs. He climbs up them, disappearing on the second floor. Peter, Meg, and Lois enter the house.

Dialogue: (to Meg) Now go to your room and don't come out until we say!
What's going on?
Meg got in a fight with Chris's girlfriend. Oh, I can only imagine how Connie must be feeling right now.

Action: The camera adjusts on the outside of the office door. From inside, we can hear Connie moaning.

Dialogue: Almost! Almost! A little more!
YES!

Action: Connie and Principal Shepherd are playing TWISTER, and Principal Shepherd is reaching his hand towards the blue circle.

Dialogue: Got it!
You sure are good at this.
At last! My flying device is now completed!
Action: Stewie is making a flying machine which looks strikingly similar to a high-tech flying saucer.

Dialogue: No floor will get me up here!
Action: Stewie steps inside the flying device and activates the controls. The machine lifts up from the ground.
He remains in the air, bobbing up and down with the machine. He becomes excited with the vibration. He unzips his overalls.

Dialogue: Hey Meg, can I use your phone?
Action: Chris enters Meg's bedroom, where Meg is lying on her bed crying her eyes out.

Dialogue: Why? So you can call Connie Demico? Chris, I can't let you see her anymore!
Why not?
She's using you. She doesn't care about you at all.
No way. She wouldn't use me.
She is, Chris! She's using you to get back at her ex boyfriend!
Hmmm.. Now that I think about it...
Oh my gosh! Here comes my ex boyfriend!
Action: Chris and Connie are shopping together.

Dialogue: Who cares-

Action: Connie grabs Chris's neck and pulls him in. They make out as Connie's ex boyfriend passes. Connie pulls away. Her ex didn't even notice.

Dialogue: I disagree.

Action: Connie stares at Chris's crotch. Her eyes grow wide.

Dialogue: I guess it was never meant to be. She was hard to keep up with anyway.
Action: Meg sighs at Chris.

Dialogue: I'm sorry, Chris.
That's okay, Meg. I'm gonna go check on Stewie. He's been acting really weird lately.

Action: Suddenly, the floor begins shaking. ANOTHER EARTHQUAKE! The floor splits in two as pieces of wood begin falling down on the siblings.

Dialogue: Oh, God! THE GAME!
Action: Stewie gasps as his bedroom floor begins splitting down the middle. Stewie is safe. But something's wrong. Stewie sees a JUMANJI game dangling off of the edge of the large crack in the floor. He moves the machine down, quickly grabbing it.

Dialogue: RUPERT!
Action: He suddenly notices RUPERT, his beloved gay Teddy Bear, dangling off of the edge of the crack as well.
He moves his machine towards Rupert, but it won't fit in the crack.

Dialogue: Don't worry, Rupert! I'm coming!
Action: Stewie jumps out of his machine, falling into the crack and grabbing Rupert before he falls.

Dialogue: OH MY GOD! THE KIDS!!
Action: Lois, Peter, and Brian are panicking as the floor below them shakes violently.
Peter gasps while Lois and Brian run up the stairs.

Dialogue: Stewie, Chris, and Meg run into the hallway. Lois grabs her kids and holds all of them in her arms, as well as Brian. The earthquake stops.
Is everybody okay?
Yeah. I think so.
I told you the floor would strike again! And I was prepared! From this day forward, I shall not suffer from the floor's tendencies to kill! Victory is mine!
Come on, kids. Let's go downstairs before the floor caves in.
Action: Everybody walks down the

Dialogue: Meg is in the front. Meg suddenly steps in the bear trap that Peter had set on the steps earlier. She falls down the stairs. She doesn't move.
OH MY GOD!! Can you believe that bear trap didn't move all that time?
Action: Peter sees her body on the floor with the bear trap stuck to her foot.
